name: vscode-neovim
description: Vim mode for VSCode, powered by Neovim

vscode-neovim.neovimPath.title: Neovim path
vscode-neovim.neovimPath.deprecationMessage: Remove this setting and use neovimExecutablePaths.win32/linux/darwin instead. If you continue to use this setting, keep in mind this setting takes precedence over neovimExecutablePaths.windows/linux/darwin and those settings won't work. If you want them to work, just remove this setting from your settings.json or make its input box in User Settings empty

vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.win3.title: Neovim executable path on Windows
vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.win3.markdownDescription:
Path to Nvim executable if running VS Code on Windows. 
- Example: `C:\tools\neovim\Neovim\bin\nvim.exe` (if you installed using Chocolatey)
- If you want to use Windows Subsystem for Linux, enable the `useWSL` setting and set `neovimExecutablePaths.linux` instead

vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.darw.title: Neovim executable path on macOS
vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.darw.markdownDescription: Path to Nvim executable if running VS Code on macOS.

vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.linu.title: Neovim executable path on Linux (and in WSL)
vscode-neovim.neovimExecutablePaths.linu.markdownDescription:
Path to Nvim executable if running VS Code on Linux or WSL. 
- Example: `/usr/bin/nvim`
- If `useWSL` setting is checked, vscode-neovim will look for this path in default WSL distro.

vscode-neovim.neovimInitPath.title: Custom init.vim path
vscode-neovim.neovimInitPath.deprecationMessage: Use neovimInitVimPaths.win32/linux/darwin instead. If you continue to use this setting, keep in mind this setting takes precedence over neovimInitVimPaths.win32/linux/darwin and those settings won't work. If you want them to work, just remove this setting from your settings.json or make its input box in User Settings empty

vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.win32.title: Custom init.vim path on Windows
vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.win32.markdownDescription: Path to alternative `init.vim` file on Windows, equivalent to Nvim startup option `-u`. If `useWSL` is enabled, the value of the `neovimInitVimPaths.linux` setting will be used to find the init.vim file instead. You can also use `exists('g:vscode')` in your `init.vim` to check if Nvim is running in vscode.

vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.darwin.title: Custom init.vim path on macOS
vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.darwin.markdownDescription: Path to alternative `init.vim` file on macOS, equivalent to Nvim startup option `-u`. You can also use `exists('g:vscode')` in your `init.vim` to check if Nvim is running in vscode.

vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.linux.title: Custom init.vim path on Linux
vscode-neovim.neovimInitVimPaths.linux.markdownDescription: Path to alternative `init.vim` file on Linux or default WSL distro, equivalent to Nvim startup option `-u`. If the `useWSL` setting is checked, this path will be used to find `init.vim` in Windows Subsystem for Linux. You can also use `exists('g:vscode')` in your `init.vim` to check if Nvim is running in vscode.

vscode-neovim.afterInitConfig.title: After init config
vscode-neovim.afterInitConfig.markdownDescription: Config to be sourced after init config. e.g. : `["echo 'hello'", "lua << EOF", "require'vscode-neovim'.notify('world')", "EOF"]`

vscode-neovim.neovimWidth.title: Neovim width
vscode-neovim.neovimWidth.description: Neovim viewport width. Increase if you're working with long lines and have horizontal scroll problems. Larger values will affect neovim performance

vscode-neovim.completionDelay.title: Completion Delay
vscode-neovim.completionDelay.description: The delay in ms until the wildmenu completions are shown. This is to not bother you when you write :w or :noh.

vscode-neovim.neovimViewportHeightExtend.title: Neovim viewport height extend
vscode-neovim.neovimViewportHeightExtend.description: How much to extend neovim viewport on each side beyond vscode editor size. Increase if you are not seeing decorations or highlights on the edges of the editor.

vscode-neovim.ctrlKeysForNormalMode.description: Enabled Ctrl keys in normal/visual/etc...(except insert) modes

vscode-neovim.ctrlKeysForInsertMode.description: Enabled Ctrl keys in insert mode

vscode-neovim.editorLangIdExclusions.description: Will disable all keyboard shortcuts when the current editorLangId is in the list

vscode-neovim.useWSL.markdownDescription: Use neovim installed in [default WSL distro](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/basic-commands#run-a-specific-linux-distribution-from-powershell-or-cmd). If you enable this setting, specify the path to the neovim executable installed in WSL `neovimExecutablePaths.linux` setting.

vscode-neovim.wslDistribution.markdownDescription: Specify the WSL distribution to run neovim in. Use default WSL distro if empty. Use wsl.exe --list to see available distros

vscode-neovim.revealCursorScrollLine.markdownDescription: If 'true' reveals the cursor when scrolling by line and if it is outside view port

vscode-neovim.logOutputToConsole.markdownDescription:
Log to vscode developer console (not output channel!). 
- Hint: Run the `Developer: Toggle Developer Tools` command to see the console. 
- Hint: Adjust the `vscode-neovim.logLevel` setting to see more messages.

vscode-neovim.highlightGroups.highlights.title: Highlight Groups Configuration
vscode-neovim.highlightGroups.highlights.description: Define colors for various VIM highlight groups. Values are text decoration properties object

backgroundColor.description: CSS styling property that will be applied to the decoration attachment

color.description: CSS styling property that will be applied to the decoration attachment

border.description: CSS styling property that will be applied to the decoration attachment

borderColor.description: CSS styling property that will be applied to the decoration attachment

textDecoration.description: CSS styling property that will be applied to the decoration attachment

vscode-neovim.normalSelectionDebounceTim.description: Debounce time used to synchronize selection from VSCode to Nvim, typically referring to cursor movement

vscode-neovim.mouseSelectionDebounceTime.description: Debounce time for synchronizing mouse selection. Set to 0 to disable synchronization

commands.title: Neovim: Send key to neovim, syncing if in insert mode
Neovim: Send multiple keys to neovim, used for insert mode paste
Neovim: Send escape key to neovim, or other keys that will exit insert mode

scripts.format: pre-commit run --all prettier && pre-commit run --all stylua-github
scripts.test: npm run test:unit && npm run test:integration
